abstract: Citigroup posted a first-quarter profit of $4.4 billion, the best since the financial crisis erupted.
snippet: Citigroup posted a first-quarter profit of $4.4 billion, the best since the financial crisis erupted.
lead_paragraph: With Citigroup under siege last year, Richard D. Parsons, its chairman, told shareholders at the annual meeting that the bank skipped the coffee and doughnuts to save cash after three bailouts.

headline.main: Citigroup’s Annual Meeting Is More Relaxed After Big Quarterly Profit
headline.print_headline: Citigroup’s Annual Meeting Is More Relaxed After Big Quarterly Profit

abstract: Inside the Hilton New York auditorium, the mood was decidedly more upbeat than Citigroup meetings in years past. The strong quarterly showing provided a fresh chance for Vikram S. Pandit, the bank’s chief, to tell investors his turnaround plans were working.
snippet: Inside the Hilton New York auditorium, the mood was decidedly more upbeat than Citigroup meetings in years past. The strong quarterly showing provided a fresh chance for Vikram S. Pandit, the bank’s chief, to tell investors his turnaround plans we...
lead_paragraph: With Citigroup under siege last year, Richard D. Parsons, its chairman, told shareholders at the annual meeting that the bank skipped the coffee and doughnuts to save cash after three bailouts, Eric Dash reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Citi’s Yearly Meeting More Relaxed After Profit
